node.title: Experts believe 700kg cocaine caught at border was destined for another country
node.description: Experts say the amount caught far exceeded how much is usually consumed in Aotearoa, and so they suspect the shipment's intended final destination was another country.
node.content:
["Illicit drug experts suspect 700kg of cocaine seized on a ship docked in Tauranga was destined for another country.", "", "
Packages of cocaine found in a shipping container from South America. Photo: Supplied / Customs
", "Customs announced the bust yesterday - New Zealand's biggest ever.", "It tops another record sting two weeks ago, when 613kg of methamphetamine was found at Auckland Airport.", "The cocaine arrived in packages in a shipping container that left South America in January.", "Customs estimates it has a potential street value of $280 million.", "Investigations manager Cam Moore said it was "extremely significant" and highlighted how organised crime groups were trying to "exploit" Aotearoa for international drug smuggling.", "He told RNZ "the use of borders and access through shipping routes is internationally a global trend, it's not just specific to New Zealand".", "Massey University illegal drug researcher and associate professor Chris Wilkins said the cocaine packages would have well-exceeded demand.", ""Cocaine use in New Zealand is really a boutique kind of market, most likely due to its high price. It's in kind of an affluent group, and it's not very widely used."", "So he suspected the packages were meant to go across the ditch.", ""In Australia, there's a much bigger market and drug smuggling organisations often use transit countries like New Zealand or some of the Pacific Islands to put drugs into Australia."", "It was sometimes "by pure chance that enforcement comes across these large shipments, just by routine searching", Wilkins said.", ""But often, they're part of quite long-term operations where they infiltrated the trafficking group or the group receiving drugs."", "Drug Foundation executive director Sarah Helm said normally only 700g of cocaine was used across Aotearoa weekly - the shipment was 1000 times that.", ""We're not even convinced that there would be a market for that amount in New Zealand, that it would so big. And maybe the intention was to ship that product on.", ""We have very, very small numbers - low levels of use - of cocaine in this country.", ""In fact, we saw a decrease in per capita wastewater, more recently."", "Helm also said busts were only part of the picture.", ""Often times when we seize a bit of product or we clamp down on one supplier, someone else will pop up in their place, because we haven't reduced demand."", "She said addiction programmes like Te Ara Oranga in Te Tai Tokerau, which police reported reduced participants' drug harm by 34 percent, needed to be rolled out nationally, to slim the market for illicit drugs in Aotearoa."]
